availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Roby (Fleming County, Kentucky, blacksmith)

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, blacksmith. Kentucky native. Son of John Roby and Mary Roby. Married to Nancy O. Roby. Father of William A. Roby and Allen Roby. Blacksmith in Fleming County in 1850 and 1860

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 1, p. 313. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Mason County, District 2, East Maysville, p. 171. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, Poplar Plains, p. 4. Birth and Death Records: Covington, Lexington, Louisville, and Newport â€“ Microfilm (before 1911), Jefferson County, Deaths, 1910, Microfilm rolls #7007125-7007131, 7011804-7011813, 7012974-7013570, 7015456-7015462, Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives, Frankfort, Kentucky. KYR-0001-029-0573.
